subject: Re: [junit] Re. GUI testing
msgSnippet: ... You don t do it in JUnit. You don t forget about netBeans or any other GUI builder you use (unless you prefer to handcode your GUIs, like me). What you do
messageBody:
Altman, Joel G. (JSC-CC)[LM] schrieb:
> I will be glad if he can tell me how to do this in Junit (point above).
> I can then forget netBeans or anything else.
>

You don't do it in JUnit. You don't forget about netBeans or any other
GUI builder you use (unless you prefer to handcode your GUIs, like me).
What you do is writing your tests in JUnit and build the GUI as usual.

Is this developer really just responsible for the layout of the GUI, or
is he also wiring the components to the application code?

Curious, Ilja
